intro: Dolichandrone stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit dolichandra, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces elongated, narrow pods that contain its seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
